subject: Philosophy
title: Animal Rights
description: A quick, practical guide to Animal Rights.

hook.text: A pig is as smart as a three-year-old child. Does it deserve moral consideration?

buildup.text: Jeremy Bentham asked the key question: 'Can they suffer?' Not 'Can they reason?' or 'Can they talk?'

discovery.text: Peter Singer argues that ignoring animal suffering is 'speciesism' â€” bias based purely on species.

twist.text: But drawing the line is hard. Do insects count? Bacteria? Where does moral consideration start?

climax.text: Factory farming causes immense suffering. The ethical case against it grows stronger every decade.

punchline.text: The question isn't can they think. It's can they suffer.

quiz.question: What criterion did Bentham suggest for moral consideration?
